meanings.definition: Capable of being thrust out or projected.
meanings.sent1: The exsertile claws of the crab helped it catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The chameleon's exsertile tongue quickly captured the insect.
meanings.sent3: The exsertile umbrella unexpectedly popped open in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her exsertile patience finally reached its limit.
meanings.sent5: The exsertile flower petals reached out to the sunlight, eager for warmth.

meanings.definition: Capable of being extended or protruded.
meanings.sent1: The exsertile antenna of the insect detected the slightest movement.
meanings.sent2: The exsertile spines of the sea urchin provided protection.
meanings.sent3: The exsertile measuring tape seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: His exsertile curiosity led him to explore new places.
meanings.sent5: The exsertile roots of the plant searched for water deep underground.

meanings.sent1: The exsertile rubber band snapped back when released.
meanings.sent2: The exsertile fabric allowed for easy movement.
meanings.sent3: The exsertile slinky toy seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: His exsertile imagination knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The exsertile limbs of the starfish reached in all directions.
